attributes.action: Set up an independent public inquiry into the management of the COVID pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that the UK did not handle the COVID 19 pandemic as well as it might have done. It is also clear that we will not be free of COVID for some time to come. It's therefore essential that we learn from the current experience in order to put in place better contingency arrangements to deal with a new surge in coronavirus infections or with any other similar pandemic in the future. It is essential that this should be done as soon as possible and should not be delayed for political reasons.
attributes.background: Hold a public inquiry into all aspects of the way the COVID 19 pandemic was handled by the UK Government, the Scottish Government, the Welsh Government, Public Health England, NHS England, NHS Scotland and NHS Wales and other public agencies. Report to the UK public on its findings.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577292
